items.label: Ban or Kick Member from a Group

advanced/connection-status.title: Connection Status
advanced/connection-status.description: CometChat SDK provides you with a mechanism to get real-time status of the connection to CometChat web-socket servers.

advanced/index.title: Advanced
advanced/index.description: This section helps you to know about the Connection Listeners.

authentication/login-listener.title: Login Listener
authentication/login-listener.description: The CometChat SDK provides you with real-time updates for the login and logout events. This can be achieved using the LoginListener class provided. LoginListener consists of 4 events that can be triggered. These are as follows:

breakout-groups.title: Breakout Groups
breakout-groups.description: Requires including an additional script breakout.js which you can from your account manager

calling/custom-css.title: Custom CSS
calling/custom-css.description: Passing custom CSS allows you to personalize and enhance the user interface of the call screen.

calling/default-call.title: Default Call
calling/default-call.description: This section will provide information on how a complete calling workflow can be set up using CometChat. We've built the complete workflow to help your users make calls, receive calls as well as accept/reject calls.

calling/index.title: Calling
calling/index.description: Calling is a core feature of CometChat. CometChat allows two mechanisms for calling

calling/recording.title: Recording (Beta)
calling/recording.description: This section will guide you to implement call recording feature for the voice and video calls.

calling/video-view-customisation.title: Video View Customisation
calling/video-view-customisation.description: This section will guide you to customise the main video container.

calling/virtual-background.title: Virtual Background
calling/virtual-background.description: This section will guide you to implement virtual background feature in video calls.

groups/change-member-scope.title: Change Member Scope
groups/change-member-scope.description: Change Scope of a Group Member

groups/index.title: Groups
groups/index.description: Groups help your users to converse together in a single space. You can have three types of groups- private, public and password protected.

groups/kick-member-from-a-group.title: Ban or Kick Member from a Group
groups/kick-member-from-a-group.description: There are certain actions that can be performed on the group members:

groups/retrieve-group-members.title: Retrieve Group Members
groups/retrieve-group-members.description: Retrieve the List of Group Members

groups/transfer-group-ownership.title: Transfer Group Ownership
groups/transfer-group-ownership.description: In other words, as a logged-in user, how do I transfer the ownership of any group if I am the owner of the group?

messaging/additional-message-filtering.title: Additional Message Filtering
messaging/additional-message-filtering.description: The MessagesRequest class as you must be familiar with helps you to fetch messages based on the various parameters provided to it. This document will help you understand better the various options that are available using the MessagesRequest class.

messaging/delete-a-conversation.title: Delete a Conversation
messaging/delete-a-conversation.description: In case you want to delete a conversation, you can use the deleteConversation() method.

messaging/delete-a-message.title: Delete a Message
messaging/delete-a-message.description: While deleting a message is straightforward, receiving events for deleted messages with CometChat has two parts:

messaging/edit-a-message.title: Edit a Message
messaging/edit-a-message.description: While editing a message is straightforward, receiving events for edited messages with CometChat has two parts:

messaging/index.title: Messaging
messaging/index.description: Messaging is one of the core features of CometChat. We've thoughtfully created methods to help you send, receive and fetch message history.

messaging/interactive-message.title: Interactive Messages
messaging/interactive-message.description: An InteractiveMessage is a specialised object that encapsulates an interactive unit within a chat message, such as an embedded form that users can fill out directly within the chat interface. This enhances user engagement by making the chat experience more interactive and responsive to user input.

messaging/mentions.title: Mentions
messaging/mentions.description: Mentions in messages enable users to refer to specific individual within a conversation. This is done by using the ` format, where UID` represents the user’s unique identification.

messaging/reactions.title: Reactions
messaging/reactions.description: Enhance user engagement in your chat application with message reactions. Users can express their emotions using reactions to messages. This feature allows users to add or remove reactions, and to fetch all reactions on a message. You can also listen to reaction events in real-time. Let's see how to work with reactions in CometChat's SDK.

messaging/receive-a-message.title: Receive a Message
messaging/receive-a-message.description: Receiving messages with CometChat has two parts:

messaging/retrieve-conversations.title: Retrieve Conversations
messaging/retrieve-conversations.description: Conversations provide the last messages for every one-on-one and group conversation the logged-in user is a part of. This makes it easy for you to build a Recent Chat list.

messaging/send-a-message.title: Send a Message
messaging/send-a-message.description: Using CometChat, you can send three types of messages:

messaging/threaded-messages.title: Threaded Messages
messaging/threaded-messages.description: Messages that are started from a particular message are called Threaded messages or simply threads.

messaging/transient-messages.title: Transient Messages
messaging/transient-messages.description: Transient messages are messages that are sent in real-time only and are not saved or tracked anywhere. The receiver of the message will only receive the message if he is online and these messages cannot be retrieved later.

overview/index.title: Overview
overview/index.description: This guide demonstrates how to add chat to a Javascript application using CometChat. Before you begin, we strongly recommend you read the Key Concepts guide.

overview/message-structure-and-hierarchy.title: Message Structure and Hierarchy
overview/message-structure-and-hierarchy.description: The below diagram helps you better understand the various message categories and types that a CometChat message can belong to.

resources/index.title: Resources
resources/index.description: We have a number of resources that will help you while integrating CometChat in your app.

setup.title: Setup
setup.description: Skip the create new app step. Your existing v3 app can be migrated to v4.

user-presence.title: User Presence
user-presence.description: User Presence helps us understand if a user is available to chat or not.

users/index.title: Users
users/index.description: The primary aim for our Users functionality is to allow you to quickly retrieve and add users to CometChat.

users/user-management.title: User Management
users/user-management.description: When a user logs into your app, you need to programmatically login the user into CometChat. But before you log in the user to CometChat, you need to create the user.
